snippet: With voters focusing on economic issues, polls suggest that Islamic-based parties will fare poorly in national legislative elections on Wednesday.
abstract: Memo From Indonesia; polls and analysts suggest ahead of Indonesia's national legislative elections that Islamic-based parties are poised for what could be their worst showing since Indonesia's democratic era began in 1999; slide in popularity appears to be worsening despite studies showing that Indonesians are becoming more pious.
lead_paragraph: With voters focusing on economic issues, polls suggest that Islamic-based parties will fare poorly in national legislative elections on Wednesday.

headline.main: In a Nation of Muslims, Political Islam Is Struggling to Win Votes
headline.print_headline: In a Nation of Muslims, Political Islam Is Struggling to Win Votes
